# Arpeggio: 13th in C# (Shape: C)

## Introduction
An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes of a chord are played in a sequence instead of simultaneously. In this case, we will be looking at the 13th arpeggio in the key of C#. It involves playing the individual notes of the 13th chord derived from the C# major scale in succession.

## Notes and Intervals
The 13th arpeggio in C# consists of the following notes: C# - E# - G# - B# - D# - F# - A# - C# (octave). The intervals between these notes are as follows: 1st (C# to E#), 3rd (E# to G#), 5th (G# to B#), 7th (B# to D#), 9th (D# to F#), 11th (F# to A#), and 13th (A# to C#).

## Genre and Musical Flavor
Arpeggios are commonly used in various genres such as classical, jazz, and progressive rock. The 13th arpeggio in C# adds a sense of complexity and color to the music due to the extended nature of the chord tones. It can create a lush and sophisticated sound, often used to add depth and richness to compositions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 13th arpeggio in C#:
1. *Song Title: Dream Theater - "The Dance of Eternity"*
   - This progressive metal instrumental showcases intricate arpeggios, including the 13th arpeggio in C#, adding to the technical and musical complexity of the piece.
   
2. *Song Title: Frederic Chopin - "Nocturne in C# minor"*
   - This classical piece by Chopin utilizes arpeggios extensively, with the 13th arpeggio in C# being a part of the rich harmonic tapestry that defines the composition.
   
3. *Song Title: Herbie Hancock - "Chameleon"*
   - This jazz-funk classic features harmonically rich arpeggios, with the 13th arpeggio in C# contributing to the sophisticated and groovy sound of the piece.

Arpeggios are versatile musical devices that can enhance compositions across various genres, and the 13th arpeggio in C# is a unique and colorful option for adding harmonic interest to music.
